commit.title: [dune] [ci] Fix Dune in Windows and test it in Appveyor's CI.
commit.message:
[dune] [ci] Fix Dune in Windows and test it in Appveyor's CI.

In order for Dune to work in Windows we need to tweak some script
calls, they need a POSIX shell and the `(run ...)` / `(system ...)`
actions use `cmd.exe` on Windows.

Hopefully, we will rely less on `bash` when Dune can understand Coq
libraries. This affects shell scripts in `kernel/**.sh` for example.

Regarding testing, we update the Appveyor configuration so it builds
Coq and runs the test suite using Dune.

It will be interesting to see how faster the Coq Windows build is (if
any).

It will be interesting to see how faster the Coq Windows build is (if
any).

commit.title: [dune] [ci] Fix Dune in Windows and test it in Appveyor's CI.
commit.message:
[dune] [ci] Fix Dune in Windows and test it in Appveyor's CI.

In order for Dune to work in Windows we need to tweak some script
calls, they need a POSIX shell and the `(run ...)` / `(system ...)`
actions use `cmd.exe` on Windows.

Hopefully, we will rely less on `bash` when Dune can understand Coq
libraries. This affects shell scripts in `kernel/**.sh` for example.

Regarding testing, we update the Appveyor configuration so it builds
Coq and runs the test suite using Dune.

It will be interesting to see how faster the Coq Windows build is (if
any).
